Description: Three fragments of an Egyptian(izing) glazed composition (faience) 'common bowl' (two of the fragments are made up of joined sherds); mould-made or -pressed and covered with a blue-green glaze and brown painted decoration; hemispherical body, rounded rim and base; the interior decoration consists of a bird with long legs (body missing) framed by wavy and oblique lines enclosed within parallel lines.
Curator's comments: See E. Peltenburg, 'Hathor, faience and copper on Late Bonrze Age Cyprus', CCEC 37 (2007), 375-394 on the Egyptian 'common bowl' on Cyprus.
Bibliographic references: Malmgren 2003 / Klavdhia-Tremithos. A Middle and Late Cypriote Bronze Age site. (no. 149, p. 56)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 218)
Kiely 2011d / Klavdia-Tremithos: A Bronze Age community in south-east Cyprus (M.5)
